title.narrative: Shelter Provision, Reintegration And Improved Livelihoods For Returnees And Idps In 4 Towns In Somaliland

description.narrative: The overall objective of the project is: to improve the living conditions of 335 long-term IDP families in urban IDP settlements in Somaliland three Regions, and facilitate their integration into the host community with improved housing, water, sanitation and enhanced livelihood opportunities

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: Government and Habitat Agenda partners’ capacity to effectively address housing, land and property in the context of crisis-prone and post-crisis countries increased

description.narrative: Government and Habitat Agenda partners’ capacity to effectively address housing, land and property in the context of crisis-prone and post-crisis countries increased

title.narrative:
Settlers recognized by host community and government authorities as permanent residents
Selection of beneficiaries done smoothly without conflicts and benefitting those most vulnerable.
Formal recognition of right to permanent residence by beneficiaries from the part of local authorities and host communities.
Beneficiaries receive documents from Municipality

description.narrative:
Settlers recognized by host community and government authorities as permanent residents
Selection of beneficiaries done smoothly without conflicts and benefitting those most vulnerable.

Beneficiaries receive documents from Municipality

comment.narrative: Secure tenure certificate issued to 335 benefiting IDPs

target.value:
Settlers identified during first 3 months of the project.
Household survey and selection of beneficiaries done during first 6 months of the project
Local government accepts to provided legal documents during first 3 months of project as part of AoC

comment.narrative: Secure tenure certificate issued to 335 benefiting IDPs
